ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: A variety of substantive research areas in comparative political science, with a wide range of methodological approaches.
Analytical research design skills covering a wide range of political and social science inquiries.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: I like the alternative research design very much, which encourage us to critically assess the empirical strategies in the readings. And the response papers definitely train our writing skills well. The feedback on the final research design has been very helpful.

I thought the homework workload was fair. Kate chose interesting books and was very good at leading interesting class discussions. However, I think we could have read and discussed two books per week. The discussions were in depth to the point of being exhaustive, and I would have liked the opportunity to make more of a dent in the required reading list for the comp exam. That being said, Kate led a great class.
Small size was conducive for individual participation at a greater level and interaction with the course convener.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes, definitely. Participants in this course can gain much in terms of knowledge, writing, and critical assessment with research designs. And the peer discussions in the class are also wonderful.
Yes, it was an interesting course and Kate is a great instructor.

Absolutely. The material is really interesting and the class sessions very participatory with a great lecturer. This course helps students to think about their current or future research interests and provides the instruction to help clarify and disentangle the questions and work needed at the pre-research phase.
